#summary Introduction to CSS Visual Effects

== Introduction ==

Welcome to *css-vfx*, a collection of components and code examples that illustrate the power of CSS Visual Effects.

Try out the demos, take a look at the source, and have fun! -- [http://www.satine.org/ Charles Ying]

== Gem 1: Cover Flow (zflow) ==

<wiki:video url="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sHLaHGxIzb4" />

[http://css-vfx.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/examples/zflow.html iPhone Safari Demo] - using flickr "interesting" photos feed

[AboutZflow How zflow is built] - Includes comments on setup, reflections, performance, inertia, etc.

== Gem 2: Snow Stack ==

<wiki:video url="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3R6sb4NO25E" />

[http://css-vfx.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/snowstack/snowstack.html WebKit Nightly Demo] (requires recent WebKit nightly on OS X Leopard, Safari on OS X Snow Leopard)

[SnowStack Snow Stack] - Details on setting up Snow Stack for your own images and links to source code.

== CSS Visual Effects References ==

Apple's 3D CSS Visual Effects extensions are available here:

 * [http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-transitions/ CSS Transitions]
 * [http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-animations/ CSS Animation]
